column4: hi, I was reading https://jdk-distros.dev.java.net/ubuntu.html because I found a press release that said that ubuntu and debian were granted licences to distriibute Java JDK.  Is this package shipped on the CD or does my machine need to be connected to the internet to get these packages?
does the current stable version of Ubuntu / Kubuntu ship with the JDK?
no, but you can apt-get install sun-java6-jdk easily
